intro: Deprea darcyana, commonly known as the Darcy's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
